subsection.name: Developer Access
subsection.p: Everyone can access the Subversion repository via HTTP, but Committers must checkout the Subversion repository via HTTPS.

section.name: Build Source Code
section.p: You can read a tutorial on how to build Apache James Server on http://james.apache.org/server/3/dev-build.html.
The SVN URLs and the project names must be adapted, but the requirements and process are the same and you can inspire from the build the Apache James IMAP libraries.

subsection.name: James Protocols API
subsection.p: apache-james-protocols-api contains the interfaces, exceptions and Constants needed by the other projects.

subsection.name: James Protocols Implementation
subsection.p: apache-james-protocols-impl provides common services that can be used by any mail protocol.

subsection.name: James Protocols SMTP
subsection.p: apache-james-protocols-smtp implements the SMTP protocols with hooks for extensions.

subsection.name: Apache James IMAP API
subsection.p: apache-james-imap-api contains the interfaces, exceptions and Constants needed by the other projects.

subsection.name: Apache James IMAP Message
subsection.p: apache-james-imap-message allows to encode, decode and structure the IMAP requests and responses.
It will provide among other the ImapRequestMessage and ImapResponseMessage implementation to be processed by the apache-james-imap-processor project.

subsection.name: Apache James IMAP Processor
subsection.p: apache-james-imap-processor implements the Chain Of Responsibility design pattern.
ImapRequestMessage and ImapResponder will be passed to the list of Processors that will execute doProcess if applicable.

subsection.name: Apache James Integration Test
subsection.p: A specific integration project is responsible to test the IMAP protocol in conjunction with the Apache James mailbox components.
